content:
Getting this message from the publisher. Any ideas?

org.hl7.fhir.exceptions.FHIRException: Error fetching package directly (http://github.com/HL7/ig-template-base/current/package.tgz), or fetching package list for fhir.base.template from http://github.com/HL7/ig-template-base/package-list.json: Input is not in the .gz format
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.PackageCacheManager.loadPackage(PackageCacheManager.java:634)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.loadPackage(TemplateManager.java:114)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.loadTemplate(TemplateManager.java:64)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.loadTemplate(TemplateManager.java:55)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.initializeFromIg(Publisher.java:1215)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.initialize(Publisher.java:1159)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.execute(Publisher.java:650)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.main(Publisher.java:6637)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Input is not in the .gz format
        at org.apache.commons.compress.compressors.gzip.GzipCompressorInputStream.init(GzipCompressorInputStream.java:193)
        at org.apache.commons.compress.compressors.gzip.GzipCompressorInputStream.<init>(GzipCompressorInputStream.java:167)
        at org.apache.commons.compress.compressors.gzip.GzipCompressorInputStream.<init>(GzipCompressorInputStream.java:131)
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.NpmPackage.readStream(NpmPackage.java:247)
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.NpmPackage.fromPackage(NpmPackage.java:242)
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.PackageCacheManager.addPackageToCache(PackageCacheManager.java:509)
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.PackageCacheManager.loadPackage(PackageCacheManager.java:632)
        ... 7 more
Press any key to continue . . .
the template seems to be working fine (just tested it)
what does your ig.ini say under Template?
@Jose Costa Teixeira template = fhir.base.template and the input cache only has the publisher jar (downloaded today)
i do not know what is the issue. What I would do:
Have you tried wiping your local package cache? (user folder/.fhir/packages)

delete any cached version of the tempalate
%userprofile%\.fhir\packages\fhir.base.template#current
OK, I cleared that cache, and now I'm getting a different error message, so there is progress!

Stack Dump (for debugging):                                                      (00:01.0747)
org.hl7.fhir.exceptions.FHIRException: Unable to resolve the package 'fhir.base.template'
        at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.cache.PackageCacheManager.loadPackage(PackageCacheManager.java:662)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.loadPackage(TemplateManager.java:167)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.installTemplate(TemplateManager.java:82)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.templates.TemplateManager.loadTemplate(TemplateManager.java:68)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.initializeFromIg(Publisher.java:1233)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.initialize(Publisher.java:1174)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.execute(Publisher.java:655)
        at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.main(Publisher.java:6705)
OK, that last one was just a firewall issue. Solved. Thanks for the help!
